column4: how do I switch run levels in ubuntu? I tried sudo init 3 and nothing happens
are you sure??
what says "runlevel" command?
I want to be able to install my nvidia drivers, can't do it while X is running
I see, but check that X11 is not at runlevel 3, btw.
cannot try it myself since I'm working... despite of chatting :-P
btw, are you using apt repositories for nvidia or just using the nvidia installer directly?
I've not yet used nvidia+ubuntu but I would try first with repositories nvidia drivers, I guess that you don't have to change your runlevel at all.
just restart Xserver once the upgrade has completed (and perhaps check before the /etc/X11/xorg.conf)
okay, thanks.
also check the wiki site, perhaps there is specific informaiton
since when??
since I installed it. I just installed Ubuntu yesterday. Had LOTS of probs
it has never worked?
no, I cannot open Firefox. It just says 'starting firefox' then it quits
I would fix the problems prior to any nvidia driver installation.
reinstall it.
the firefox I mean, of course.
also try with epiphany,...
btw you have installed flash plugin?
and are you using composite extension? (well, have you got it enabled at xorg.conf?)
-it is not enabled by default, so I guess that everything is OK)
are you whispering to me?
no... what do you mean?
